TITLE: Install NES.css via npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the NES.css package using npm, a popular package manager for JavaScript. The package is added to the project's dependencies for use in styling web applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install nes.css
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install NES.css via Yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the NES.css package using Yarn, another package manager for JavaScript. It provides an alternative way to add NES.css to a project for styling purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn add nes.css
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Include NES.css in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet demonstrates how to link the NES.css stylesheet directly within the HTML document. This is a straightforward method for incorporating the styles, referencing the file from the node_modules directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- index.html -->
<html>
  <head>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="./node_modules/nes.css/css/nes.min.css">
  </head>
  <body></body>
</html>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Include NES.css via CDN
DESCRIPTION: These HTML snippets demonstrate different ways to include NES.css from a CDN using a link tag. Options include the minified version, the latest version, and the core styles only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- minify -->
<link href="https://unpkg.com/nes.css@2.3.0/css/nes.min.css" rel="stylesheet" />
<!-- latest -->
<link href="https://unpkg.com/nes.css@latest/css/nes.min.css" rel="stylesheet" />
<!-- core style only -->
<link href="https://unpkg.com/nes.css/css/nes-core.min.css" rel="stylesheet" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Import NES.css in SCSS
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import the NES.css stylesheet into an SCSS file. This allows developers to utilize the NES.css styles within their SCSS code for modular and maintainable styling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// style.scss
@import "./node_modules/nes.css/css/nes.css"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Include NES.css with Google Font
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to include the NES.css stylesheet along with a recommended Google Font ('Press Start 2P') in an HTML document. It also includes a style block to apply a custom font family to specific HTML elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<head>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Press+Start+2P" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="https://unpkg.com/nes.css/css/nes.css" rel="stylesheet" />

    <style>
      html, body, pre, code, kbd, samp {
          font-family: "font-family you want to use";
      }
    </style>
</head>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Import NES.css in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to import the minified NES.css stylesheet directly into a JavaScript file. This approach requires a CSS loader in your build process to handle the CSS import.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
// script.js
import "nes.css/css/nes.min.css";
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the NES.css project. These dependencies are defined in the `package.json` file and are required for building and running the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Storybook for Component Visualization
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Storybook development server, allowing developers to view and interact with all available components in an interactive interface. Storybook is a tool for building UI components in isolation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ npm run storybook
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Upstream Remote for Git
DESCRIPTION: These commands add the original NES.css repository as a remote called "upstream", fetch the git information from that remote, and set the local `master` branch to use the `upstream/master` branch. This allows you to keep your local `master` branch synchronized with the original repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nostalgic-css/nes.css/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: git
CODE:
```
git remote add upstream https://github.com/nostalgic-css/NES.css.git
```

LANGUAGE: git
CODE:
```
git fetch upstream
```

LANGUAGE: git
CODE:
```
git branch --set-upstream-to=upstream/master master
```
